meanings.sent1: The man's sudden twitch was an involuntarily movement.
meanings.sent2: She blinked involuntarily when the bright light flashed.
meanings.sent3: The sneeze caught him involuntarily during the serious meeting.
meanings.sent4: His hand reached out involuntarily to catch the falling cup.
meanings.sent5: The shiver that ran down his spine was completely involuntarily.

meanings.definition: In a manner not subject to one's own will.
meanings.sent1: She involuntarily agreed to go along with the group's plan.
meanings.sent2: He involuntarily flinched when the ball flew towards him.
meanings.sent3: The cat's tail swished involuntarily as it chased the laser pointer.
meanings.sent4: The audience involuntarily gasped at the magician's final trick.
meanings.sent5: The child's hand shot up involuntarily to answer the teacher's question.
